title: The Project's Carrie Bickmore shares photos of daughter Adelaide
text:
She welcomed daughter Adelaide with partner Chris Walker in December last year.

And on Monday, The Project's Carrie Bickmore shared two adorable photos of the 10-month-old to Instagram.

'You smile at me baby girl and I forget you've been up all night four nights in a row,' the 38-year-old TV host captioned her post.

'You smile at me baby girl': The Project's Carrie Bickmore, 38, shared adorable photos of her beaming 10-month-old daughter Adelaide (pictured) to Instagram on Monday

In one photo, Adelaide was kept warm in a rainbow stripe wool ensemble and a pink puffer jacket wrapped around her tiny frame.

The tot beamed for the camera while holding onto one pink shoe.

A second shot within the post saw Adelaide wearing a white Rip Curl T-shirt and seated in the basket section of a shopping trolley.

Proud mother: One picture within the post saw Adelaide (pictured) wearing a white Rip Curl T-shirt and seated in the basket section of a shopping trolley

She held on tightly to the metal railing and showed off a gorgeous smile.

Carrie and partner Chris also share daughter Evie, four, while Chris has taken on a stepfather role to Carrie's son Oliver, 12, from her previous marriage to late husband Greg Lange.

Speaking to body+soul in April, Carrie said she doesn't strive for perfection as a mother.

Carrie (pictured) captioned her post: 'You smile at me baby girl and I forget you've been up all night four nights in a row.' Pictured behind-the-scenes on The Project

'I don't think life is ever perfectly in balance, that's OK,' she began.

'I think we should aspire to have perfect lives - the joy is in the imperfection.'

'Some days my home life takes more of my time and energy, so my work life takes a back seat; other weeks I have a crazy work schedule, so my house becomes a mess and we eat more take-away,' Carrie added.
description: She welcomed daughter Adelaide with partner Chris Walker in December last year.
authors: Kristy Johnson For Daily Mail Australia
